message: maybe @elpargo could be able to help
I'd like to grab some of the videos before I leave… Would it be possible to get them from some host on the hotel network?
That would be great for the 14 plane hours I have ahead
I wish I could download them straight down to the laptop too
Ummm I haven't done it but maybe you could swing by the green room and ask for them to be transfer
@elpargo are you there right now?
We can just hack a script to get them from the webs
or just ask anybody there?
@dnozay ask someone I'm not there
@graffic no, because that will kill the wireless for everyone else
seems like you can just download them off blip.tv using an internet cable on below level
does blip let you fetch the entire thing as a single bundle or does it require 200 clicks?
/me might dl everything and offer a wget-able archive on my laptop for y'all.
+100 for this idea
if someone volunteered to dl them all, we could build a local mirror...
http://python.mirocommunity.org/ suggests you could fire up Miro and download most of them
http://pycon.blip.tv/rss -- add that feed to your sidebar.
miro doesn't have 2011 up yet
that would be so useful - would love to dump them on my ipad for airport/airplane watching
Still, not exactly a local mirror.
...and it's isn't trivial to dl from blip, nor is the local server "easily accessible"
@ryazwinski http://cl.ly/2w3Q1h392D0d3Z0b252w
It does…
There's one 2011 talk on miro now - might be worth seeing if we could help get them up faster as it's torrent based and most of us are on the same subnet
Choose "download all" after setting your bandwidth limits sensibly (I'm using 1MiB/s down, 256KiB/s up.)
Sidebar menu, Add Feed item (⌘N), paste the previous URL in.
ah blip does have dl link - my bad..
@GothAlice what app are you using?
In fact, Miro is torrent-based, so if we all start downloading the videos, we'll bandwidth share amongst ourselves, too.
@GothAlice what do you mean by add to sidebar?
nm... you dl and share, I'll grab from you... no point in multiple people saturating the wifi
@ryazwinski I'm using Miro, a distributed, bittorrent-based way of sharing open video and audio content.  If you use it, you /will/ be downloading from me, and from everyone else using Miro here.
It's quite efficient — I peaked around 2.5MiB/s before throttling it for the sake of everyone else on the WiFi.
Wondering why python.mirocommunity.org doesn't have a conferences/pycon2011 category…
Ah, @moogatronic, but then you don't get the benefits of bandwidth sharing.
if you're using itunes, you can just subscribe to the whole pycon2011 feed in itunes and "get all" on the podcasts.
Miro has a similar get all option.
@jaaaarel It will soon, the update is a manual process
@GothAlice how goes the dling? can I meet you with a datakey (assuming you're still here)
